intro: Hedeoma drummondii var. reverchonii, commonly known as Drummond's hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or violet in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
